abstract.text: An object that builds audio and video output settings dictionaries.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use an output settings assistant to create the audio and video settings that you use to configure instances of
. You create an assistant with a specific preset configuration, such as

. You can accept the settings dictionaries as is to generate a file that conforms to the criteria that the preset implies. You may also use the dictionaries it generates as a base configuration that you can customize as you require.
Providing the assistant additional details about your source media helps it generate more complete results. For example, setting a value for its
property ensures that the assistant generates settings that don’t scale up video frames from a smaller size.

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
An object that writes media data to a container file.
An object that appends media samples to a track in an asset writer’s output file.
A group of inputs with tracks that are mutually exclusive to each other for playback or processing.
An object that appends timed metadata groups to an asset writer input.
An object that appends video samples to an asset writer input.
An object that appends tagged buffer groups to an asset writer input.
An object that builds audio and video output settings dictionaries.
An audio settings dictionary.
Returns an array of preset values to use to initialize an output settings assistant.
Creates an output setting assistant with a preset configuration.
A uniform type identifier (UTI) that indicates the type of file to write.
The format of the source audio data.
A time value that describes the average frame duration of the video data.
The format of the source video data.
A time value that describes the minimum frame duration of the video data.
A video settings dictionary.
A structure that defines preset configurations for an output settings assistant.
A preset for HEVC with Alpha video at 3840 by 2160 pixels.
A preset for H.264 video at 1920 by 1080 pixels.
Create video content for visionOS by converting an existing 3D HEVC file to a multiview HEVC format, optionally adding spatial metadata to create a spatial video.

doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentati.title: Converting side-by-side 3D video to multiview HEVC and spatial video

abstract.text: Check color reproduction for a video in your app by using test patterns, video test equipment, and light-measurement instruments.
Inspect and set video color space information when writing and transcoding media.

doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentati.title: Tagging Media with Video Color Information

abstract.text: Create an HTTP Live Streaming presentation by turning a movie file into a sequence of fragmented MPEG-4 files.

doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentati.title: Writing Fragmented MPEG-4 Files for HTTP Live Streaming

abstract.text: Add spatial metadata to stereo photos and videos to create spatial media for viewing on Apple Vision Pro.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Creating spatial photos and videos with spatial metadata

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
